const digit_t digit_hibit = (digit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit-1))
const doubledigit_t doubledigit_hibit = (doubledigit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit*2-1))
const doubledigit_t digit_overflowbit = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_digit)
const digit_t digit_mask = digit_t(digit_overflowbit-1)

Detailed Description

The items within this namespace are meant for internal use only.

Typedef Documentation

typedef boost::uint_t<std::numeric_limits<doubledigit_t>::digits / 2>::fast boost::xint::detail::digit_t

This is the type used to store information about the integer. It must contain at least half the number of bits that a doubledigit_t can hold, and is most memory-efficient when it's exactly that.

Definition at line 60 of file xint.hpp.

typedef boost::uintmax_t boost::xint::detail::doubledigit_t

This is the type used for calculations. It should be the largest built-in integral type the system can offer, for maximum processing efficiency.

Definition at line 52 of file xint.hpp.
